Intervention : PRn was given and it has been effective but after a few hours resident has been aggressive. Time, Frequency and # of Staff : Evaluation of Intervention : Redirect resident but still aggressive. Resident Response : The resident has been aggressive.

other_notes: Behaviour Note (2025-09-04 09:55:00): Behaviour Displayed : Resident grabbed nurse M.L. RN shirt and pulled her to the floor as she was trying to remove the BP cuff from his arm after checking his BP while he was sitting down by the nursing station. She called out for help. PSW C.B. came and found her on the flooron her back. PSW assisted with separating resident from M.L. C.B. called writer for help. As she was on the phone, resident got up and pushed the chair towards another resident D.H. who was coming to assist the nurse on the floor. C.B. witnessed the incident and then resident fell backwards onto his buttocks. Intervention : Code was called, staff rushed to the unit to assist. RAI coordinator D.L. was present in the building at the time, D.L. and other staff members assisted with helping nurse M.L. off the floor. Writer attended to D.H. who had a skin tear on her foot and wasin pain. Other staff members assisted with getting resident off the floor and distracting him. Ministry was called CI # AH-2025-0002348. Police was called to report the incident as per protocol, resident D.H. stated that resident didn't know what he was doing and didn't want to call the police. Case # 25-9344. 2 police officers came in and spoke to RN M.L., resident was sleeping at the time and D.H. didn't want to involve police therefore no need to take her statement. MOC and DOC were notified by RAI coordinator D.L. Time, Frequency and # of Staff : 2 incidents within 1-2 minutes Evaluation of Intervention : effective POA was notified by D.L. Resident Response : Resident didn't realize what he did, he came and talked to RN M.L. later and talked to writer. He was pointing to D.H. and saying that she was hi sister. Resident went to bed later and stayed there for a few hours before getting up again.
